Holbox completely lived up to and honestly exceeded its Michelin-star reputation. We ordered the scallop ceviche, kampachi, lobster, and the fresh uni‚Ä¶ and every dish was an absolute standout.

The scallop ceviche was bright and silky, bursting with clean citrus flavors. The kampachi had that perfect buttery texture, so fresh it practically melted. The lobster was rich, sweet, and cooked to perfection. But the uni wow. Creamy, briny, and unbelievably fresh‚Ä¶ now I fully understand why Holbox earned its Michelin star.

Every plate was thoughtful, balanced, and executed with precision. This is seafood at its highest level innovative, respectful of the ingredients, and genuinely unforgettable.

Holbox remains one of LA‚Äôs true culinary gems. If you love world-class seafood, this place is non-negotiable. Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Hidden inside Mercado La Paloma, Holbox is a Michelin-starred seafood counter that completely lives up to the hype.
We tried the uni & scallop tostada ‚Äî freshly opened sea urchin topped with scallop and green salsa, unbelievably sweet and creamy.
The Filete al Carbon (grilled sea bass with cilantro rice) was perfectly cooked ‚Äî crispy skin, tender meat, and full of flavor.
Both octopus and fried fish tacos were light, crunchy, and fresh, especially with their house-made hot sauces.
The Kanpachi ceviche was bright and balanced, a perfect mix of acid and spice.

Everything tasted so clean and ocean-fresh.
It‚Äôs a casual spot, not fancy at all, but the quality easily rivals high-end restaurants. This is a fantastic food and at a great price point for an one michelin star restaurant.  The atmosphere is nothing to write home about as it is in a food hall and you find your own table.  But you do not come here for the atmosphere...  It is the food.  The seafood is super fresh - you really can taste the freshness.  We ordered multiple tacos - baja fish, shrimp, octopus, grilled fish, grilled branzino, ceviche...  Each dish was great.  The price - ridiculously inexpensive...  For all the food we ordered, the total bill was about $125 with tips...  A long wait, however.  We arrived @ around 2:00 PM on Saturday and waited for almost one hour!  Worth it, however Food: 5 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 2

Chef Gilberto Cetina draws deeply from his Yucat√°n roots to create a seafood-marisquer√≠a experience that feels both authentic and elevated. The menu features ceviches, tostadas, aguachiles and tacos, all built around fresh, well-sourced local seafood with bold citrus, chile and brine flavors.

Located inside Mercado La Paloma in South-Central L.A., a food-hall environment, Holbox is unpretentious and energetic but still delivers on incredible high-end cooking.

The restaurant has earned major recognition: a Michelin star (2024) and a ranking in the top echelon of LA and North America‚Äôs best restaurants.

Reservations are an absolute must and are next to impossible to get given the limited number of counter seats. A fair amount of persistence will be required to dine here.

For those in LA craving top-tier seafood, a pilgrimage to Holbox is an absolute must. Note that service is brisk and all dishes are served at the same time. Portions are also substantial so be sure to come hungry! Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Wait time No wait

My brother took me this Michelin-starred seafood place. Though it‚Äôs in a food hall, it‚Äôs not food hall prices. The quality of the dishes were still outstanding and worthy of the cost.

The highlight for me was the sopa de mariscos. The flavors reminded me of how we used to have it as a youth, if not the texture. The seafood was abundant and fresh. Other highlights include the delicious tostadas and the fresh uni and scallop. Try all the dishes with their home made hot sauces.

Though the wait was about 25 minutes to be sat at prime dinner time, it‚Äôs still definitely worth it. We‚Äôll be back. Came here with a friend for lunch on Friday and this place totally deserves its Michelin star. We got there about 15 minutes before opening, so parking was easy and we were part of the first group in line.

Holbox serves Yucat√°n-style seafood tacos, and every single one we tried was incredible. We ordered the scallop taco, octopus taco, smoked kanpachi taco, Baja fish taco, and the aguachile with spot prawn and scallops. The scallop was buttery and sweet, the octopus was super tender with that perfect char, and the smoked kanpachi had this deep, smoky flavor that was just insane. The aguachile was bright, spicy, and refreshing‚Äîperfect for a warm day.

The service was exceptional. You order at the counter, and they somehow manage to bring everything out quickly and perfectly timed, even with so many tables scattered around the market. It‚Äôs impressive how smoothly everything runs.

We finished with the churros and chocolate sauce, which were the perfect ending‚Äîcrispy, light, and the chocolate was rich but not overly sweet.

The small lot is paid (about $4 an hour), but there‚Äôs some free street parking if you get lucky. Definitely worth coming a little early for a spot.

Can‚Äôt wait to come back and try more of the menu, especially anything with uni. This place is a gem. I had huge expectation for Michelle 1 star. Long story short, it is not worth to wait 1 hour to get the food. I might try again if no line.
The octopus was good but not exceptional, the sauce was not aligned with octopus and not tasty.
The Aguachille was too sour and couldn't enjoy it well. Octopus taco was good. Smoked kanpachi taco was hmmmm. I don't smell any smoke and just plain taco.
Urchin was good and I might come back for it. Lemonade was fresh good, but not super excellent. Dish setting is good for the price but not Michelle star up scale.
I think there are lots of people due to relatively reasonable price for Michelle star, but taste is not balanced well, and not tasty  for the star value. Food: 4 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 4

We visited Holbox and the experience was very good overall. We ordered octopus, octopus tacos, shrimp tacos, and lemonade with soda.

The octopus was very well prepared, tender, and flavorful. The octopus and shrimp tacos were an excellent choice: a good portion, fresh ingredients, and well presented.

The lemonade with soda was refreshing, although a little sweet for my taste.

The service was friendly and fast, and the atmosphere is relaxed, ideal for enjoying seafood with friends or family.

Overall, a recommended experience if you like seafood with a twist. Food: 4 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 4

I wish I could lobotomize myself so I can try this once again. I dead-ass had a ratatouille moment, smiled to myself, and got transported for like two seconds to my childhood. The tostada that sent me was: Tostada de Jurel  Local wild caught yellowtail, almond salsa macha, avocado puree... The other food we devoured and savoured was... Ceviche Mixto: wild Mexican shrimp, Yucatan octopus & local halibut ceviche, and Scallop Aguachile: baja bay scallops, lime-serrano-cilantro marinade, avocado... and the Sopa de Mariscos Seafood stew, local fish, mussels, shrimp, local rockfish, house made fish sausage & grilled bread ... and I could care less about the Baja Fish Taco  Crispy battered local rockfish, crema, mayo, salsa roja, pico de gallo. After a serious ceremony at Malibu Beach, I decided to have something special. Then the nightmare started. It was only about 28 miles, but I spent almost two hours to arrive at Holbox. I don't know why the traffic was so horrible that day, or maybe it was just as normal as every day.

For friends who know me, I don't go to fine dining frequently. I had too much fine dining back in Shanghai. I'd rather find interesting dining spots--inside food courts, at food trucks, etc. Holbox is a Michelin one-star restaurant, but not pricey. Even though it's in a food court and not a traditional restaurant, it's interesting. The food booth doesn't have its own tables in the food court; they're shared with others.

It's a Mexican food booth. The boss lady--puebla in Spanish--was tough, but not rude. As with most Michelin spots, there was a queue, but it wasn't too long. I grabbed a table stand and found us a place to sit.

Not long after, the food was served. The free tortilla chips had no shining points--just as normal as in every Mexican restaurant. Crispy, flat dipping, better than nothing. Good for snacking after a long drive.

The food was served one by one, or you could say delivered one by one:

Erizo 5/5
The word erizo in Spanish means hedgehog, but it can also mean sea urchin. They actually look quite similar. Basically, it's sea urchin. Not everyone likes it--some love it, some hate it. I'm a big fan, uni in Japanese. There were two sea urchins, each with about four or five roes. Underneath were fish and scallop ceviches, but different from normal ceviche--it was lighter, without vinegar or lemon taste, more pure raw seafood. I liked it. Not cheap at $27 for an appetizer.

Taco de Pulpo en su Tinta (Octopus Taco) 5/5
Basically, it's an octopus taco, mixed with squid ink or cuttlefish in--I couldn't tell. The ink mostly gave it color, with just a faint hint of the sea for flavor. Each taco had a giant octopus tentacle--three tacos on a plate, one tentacle for each. The texture was excellen--soft, tender, not juicy but still moist, not fishy at all. I bet the octopus was stewed for a long time, which made it so tasty. Very good. $7 for three, which I wouldn't call expensive--actually well priced.

Pescado a las Brasas 5/5
Fish, who doesn't like fish? A few-bone fish, no tiny bones. The seabass had only one big bone but no tiny bones between the muscles. It was grilled seabass, not heavily marinated but well seasoned. The freshness was its biggest strength.

Cilantro Rice and Black Beans 5/5
The rice was served with the grilled seabass, dipped in stewed black beans. I had never tried that before, but it was tasty. Not too much cilantro aroma, but still good. The rice itself was perfectly cooked--grains separated, not sticky. Paired with the black beans, it was a great match.

I recommend this food booth in the food court, not only because of its Michelin crown, but also for the way they used squid/cuttlefish ink, how they treated cilantro, lemon, and avocado. They truly put heart into making good food. Every dish we tried was beautifully presented and bursting with fresh, vibrant flavors:
‚Ä¢	The scallop taco on a blue corn tortilla was perfectly seared and paired with a bright, tangy sauce‚Äîsimple yet unforgettable.
‚Ä¢	The fresh sea urchin served right in the shell was creamy and sweet, a true taste of the ocean.
‚Ä¢	The grilled octopus with green rice and black beans had a wonderful char and tender bite.

Service was warm and welcoming, and the colorful tiled tables made the whole experience feel festive and authentic.

If you‚Äôre looking for outstanding seafood with a creative Mexican twist, Holbox is absolutely worth the trip. Highly recommended Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Was in LA for two days and took an hour uber to check this place out. Unexpected location in a food court of an easy to miss building, but the food is AMAZING. Staff was kind, attentive, and helpful. Prices are very reasonable.

Most unique dish was the uni served in the sea urchin with scallop ceviche. Just a cool experience and tasted amazing. Uni was just a mildly sweet, creamy, and ocean brine/salt flavor.

I‚Äôd 100% get the fish tacos and the blue fin tuna ceviche with tostadas again every time. Both of those were the best of I‚Äôve ever had and were just insanely fresh and flavorful.

The octopus was GREAT, but just not something I‚Äôd get every time. Meal type Dinner Price per person $30‚Äì50 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Ordered for two people:
- Tostada de mero $11
- Scallop aguachile $16
- Ceviche mixto $20
- Smoked kanpachi taco $7
- Scallop taco $5
- Filete al carbon $16
- Onsite parking: < $3 for one hour
- Total: about $90, or ~$45/person with leftovers

The aguachile and ceviche had the same mild flavor but with different proteins, so it would have been sufficient to have ordered one or the other. The octopus in the ceviche was tender unlike other places that are rubbery and hard to chew, nor was it fishy, so you know it's fresh.

The kanpachi taco was a bit too salty.

The green rice that came with the filete al carbon was surprisingly tasty and actually one of our favorite parts.

The salsas are extremely spicy (rare and appreciated) and best to use as a few droplets rather than lather over the tacos.

As for the experience, we had read that the lines would be long and went with flexible expectations and acknowledged that it was a possibility we may arrive and not have a chance to try it. Arrived around 11:30 AM on a Thursday and the line was out the door. The parking lot and street parking were full and people there said it would be about an hour wait so we got a printed menu to go (since it changes every day). We did not feel comfortable leaving our cars so far away from view so we stayed inside it, reviewed the menu, called to order, and waited 45 minutes for the food. When we returned to pick up the food, we managed to get a parking spot as a person left. We chose parking for one hour for around $2.75 since 2 hours was around $8. Since it's a food court, we were able to eat our "to-go" food anywhere except at the Holbox bar.

This was our first Michelin star experience and probably one of the most affordable options out there, so we'll definitely recommend it for budget-conscious people looking for exceptionally fresh and quality ingredients. However, the flavor itself was pretty mild and parking is extremely limited, so be prepared to pay with your time (maybe get in line first at 10:30 AM before it opens). 2025-

Has been awhile since we been back here.  Had an opportunity to introduce my niece visiting from Minnesota to real seafood and real Yucat√°n food.  Worth the drive here from the Inland Empire area.  This is located in a food halls where other food stalls.  We went straight to the line, 15-30 min wait.  Ordered at the counter and pick a table and they will bring your food out.
We ordered scallops Aguachiles, pulpo a la brasa and Kanpachi collar.  All the dishes are so fresh especially the Scallops are melted in your mom.  They have a condiments station where all the hot sauce is homemade.  Some are spicer than others but all are really good.  Vibrant dining hall and the noise level is pretty decent.  Plenty of off street and designated parking lot.  Have to go again to try other food stalls in this building.

Such a cute place to dine out.  Food court spot/market with other food counter  options.  The outdoor dining area is so cute.  Easy to find a spot to sit.  They have a small parking lot and also have off street parking as well.   All the ceviche dishes are divine. Holbox is a seafood paradise where every dish feels alive with flavor and precision. The oysters are pristine and briny, paired simply with salsas and lime that heighten their natural freshness. The ceviche is bright and elegant, perfectly balanced between citrus and herbs. The seafood soup is a standout, a rich and soulful broth layered with shrimp, mussels, and fish, crowned with vibrant cabbage for crunch and contrast. The pulpo/octopus taco is unforgettable, smoky and tender against the earthy blue corn tortilla, lifted by lime and tomato. Holbox captures the essence of coastal cooking at its highest level, refined, soulful and unforgettable. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!! Finally got to experience Holbox, and it lived up to the hype. Located inside a food hall, the line can stretch out the door depending on when you arrive, but the counter service setup moves efficiently.

We ordered: Tostada de Kanpachi & Uni, Sea Urchin, Scallop Aguachile, Smoked Kanpachi Taco, Taco de Pulpo, Blood Clams, and Langosta al Carb√≥n.

Everything was fresh and delicious. The standouts were the tostada, uni, smoked Kanpachi taco, and the grilled lobster. The Uni was fresh and buttery, served in its shell with scallop and an aioli-like sauce of somekind, mouthwatering. Lobster was grilled evenly, pre broken, served with melted butter, avocado tomatoes, and what can go wrong with a live lobster? Nothing, and they weighed the lobster in front of us, let us snap photos despite being so busy which was sweet of them. The smoked kanpachi taco was great with tender fish and a crunchy blue corn shell. The only dishes we wouldn‚Äôt order again were the blood clams, and octopus taco. The taco was chewy and the clams just didn't stand out among the rest.

The food came out as it was ready, so pacing wasn‚Äôt ideal, but understandable for this kind of spot.

All in all, Holbox is absolutely worth a visit. Just try not to get distracted by the empty stalls around it lol Meal type Lunch Price per person $50‚Äì100 Food: 5 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 4 Noise level Moderate noise Wait time 10-30 min

Came in with high hopes due to the Michelin rating and was not disappointed. My wife and I decided to do a huge sampling of whatever caught our eye on the menu.

The Spot Prawn and Scallop Aguachile was super fresh (prawns grabbed right out of the tank) and refreshing. The lime cilantro chile sauce was crisp and tasty with a hint of heat. Great summer dish.

Being a huge ceviche fan we had the Ceviche de Atun. The bluefin tuna was superb. Another well balanced crisp dish that you couldn‚Äôt stop eating.

The star of our meal though was the Tostada de Kanpachi & Uni. An absolute masterpiece. Beautifully layered textures and tastes. The uni was like icing on the cake to some amazing flavors. Even the tostada had amazing flavor. Would come back just for this dish!

The Pulpo a las Brasas was a pick of mine as I am a sucker for octopus. Super tender with a light char and smokiness. Not sure what the sauce was underneath but it was velvety smokey deliciousness. Even the side of cilantro rice and beans were top notch.

Tacos: We had the Baja Fish Taco and the Smoked Kanpachi Taco. Best fish taco I have ever had in my life. Fish was crisp and not greasy. Perfect amount of crema and salsa. The Kanpachi taco was delicious as well but the Baja taco was just a masterpiece of a taco staple. One thing that got my attention in both was the blue corn tortillas. This is what a tortilla is supposed to be. Never had such delicious tortillas in my life. Crazy how the smallest part of the dish can hold up everything and compete in flavor with the exotic ingredients.

Also enjoyed: we had the sparkling lemonade (tasted more like orange to me). Whatever was in it was amazing and refreshing. Not too sweet.

Pricing: who cares. I thought for the level of execution and the quality of ingredients the dishes would be a value at even a higher price point. Great value in my eyes.

Came in with high hopes due to the Michelin rating and was not disappointed. My wife and I decided to do a huge sampling of whatever caught our eye on the menu.

The Spot Prawn and Scallop Aguachile was super fresh (prawns grabbed right out of the tank) and refreshing. The lime cilantro chile sauce was crisp and tasty with a hint of heat. Great summer dish.

Being a huge ceviche fan we had the Ceviche de Atun. The bluefin tuna was superb. Another well balanced crisp dish that you couldn‚Äôt stop eating.

The star of our meal though was the Tostada de Kanpachi & Uni. An absolute masterpiece. Beautifully layered textures and tastes. The uni was like icing on the cake to some amazing flavors. Even the tostada had amazing flavor. Would come back just for this dish!

The Pulpo a las Brasas was a pick of mine as I am a sucker for octopus. Super tender with a light char and smokiness. Not sure what the sauce was underneath but it was velvety smokey deliciousness. Even the side of cilantro rice and beans were top notch.

Tacos: We had the Baja Fish Taco and the Smoked Kanpachi Taco. Best fish taco I have ever had in my life. Fish was crisp and not greasy. Perfect amount of crema and salsa. The Kanpachi taco was delicious as well but the Baja taco was just a masterpiece of a taco staple. One thing that got my attention in both was the blue corn tortillas. This is what a tortilla is supposed to be. Never had such delicious tortillas in my life. Crazy how the smallest part of the dish can hold up everything and compete in flavor with the exotic ingredients.

Also enjoyed: we had the sparkling lemonade (tasted more like orange to me). Whatever was in it was amazing and refreshing. Not too sweet.

Pricing: who cares. I thought for the level of execution and the quality of ingredients the dishes would be a value at even a higher price point. Great value in my eyes.

This place is consistent every time. They serve some amazing seafood dishes and great service, we got one of the combos, 2 shrimp tacos with fish ceviche  and shrimp aguachiles plus black clams.  The order took maybe 15min and they bring it to your table. They also give you complimentary chips and house salsa. I always bring people to la Paloma because if they're into seafood,  there are others restaurants to choose from.

Holbox is a Los Angeles restaurant specializing in Mexican seafood. Located in Mercado La Paloma in South Central, it serves fresh and creative dishes like ceviche, octopus tacos, and uni tostadas. The restaurant has earned recognition, receiving the Los Angeles Times' Restaurant of the Year award in 2023 and a Michelin star in 2024. If you're looking for a seafood experience that feels like a quick trip to the coast of Mexico without leaving California, Holbox is a must-visit. This hidden gem delivers on bold, coastal flavors with an elevated twist.

I tried the uni and scallop tostada, and it was absolutely mind-blowing‚Äîso fresh, bright, and beautifully balanced. The wood-grilled octopus was cooked to perfection, tender with just the right char, and the taco de pulpo had this incredible smoky depth that lingered pleasantly.

You can tell the chef puts a lot of care into the ingredients and presentation. The vibe is casual but refined‚Äîperfect for food lovers who want serious flavor without all the fuss.

Don‚Äôt skip the agua frescas or the Baja-style oysters. Every bite and sip felt authentic yet innovative. Holbox is a standout for seafood and one of LA‚Äôs best-kept culinary secrets. Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

They seated us at the restaurant which was nice, but we waited to get our order taken. Two couples who were behind us got their order taken at the register while we waited to get ours taken by a waiter. We got three different tacos and a shrimp cocktail. The tacos were great along with their hot sauces that they had on the side. The cocktail was good but half of the shrimps tasted like they had been freezer burned or had a weird chemical taste to it. I had my partner try it as well and they confirmed that some tasted like how they were supposed to taste and some tasted off. Holbox has earned its Michelin one-star recognition year after year, and honestly, it‚Äôs easy to see why. The flavors are bold, fresh, and layered ‚Äî and the prices are still super reasonable. Just be ready to wait a bit on weekends, especially during peak hours.
üî• Must-tries
Taco de Pulpo en su Tinta ‚Äì Not just stunning to look at (hello black taco shell), but packed with flavor. The octopus is tender, and while it leans salty, the squid ink base gives it a deep, savory vibe ‚Äî almost like olive tapenade.

üî• Ceviche Mixto ‚Äì Bright, zesty, and super refreshing. Octopus, shrimp, and sea bass come together with citrus in a way that‚Äôs perfect for anyone who loves sashimi or raw bar bites.

üî• Tostada de Kampachi + Uni ‚Äì
This is your treat yourself moment. Rich, luxe, and ridiculously good.
The casual counter setup at Mercado La Paloma adds to the charm ‚Äî it‚Äôs not fancy, but the food easily rivals upscale spots.

üí° Pro tip: Come early, grab a drink while you wait, and make it a mini food adventure. If you're looking for an unforgettable dining experience, Holbox is the place to be. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm, friendly service and a cozy atmosphere that perfectly blends casual with chic. The ambiance set the tone for what would be an amazing meal.

Now, let's talk about the food ‚Äì wow! We tried a variety of tacos, and each one was better than the last. The fish taco was incredibly fresh, with a perfect balance of flavors. The shrimp taco was cooked to perfection, plump and juicy, with just the right amount of seasoning. But the real standout for me was the octopus taco ‚Äì tender and smoky, it had an incredible depth of flavor that really impressed us.

We also had the uni ‚Äì it was beyond amazing. Fresh, creamy, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious, it was a true treat for seafood lovers. Each bite was a reminder of just how high the quality of ingredients is at Holbox.

The tacos alone are worth a visit, but we also couldn‚Äôt resist the cocktails, which were perfectly crafted and paired so well with the meal. The staff was attentive but never overbearing, and we felt like they genuinely cared about our experience.

Overall, Holbox is one of those spots where you know you‚Äôre going to get high-quality food and service every time. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back to try more of their delicious dishes ‚Äì it‚Äôs worth every penny! This is not a stand alone restaurant (although I wish it were), it‚Äôs inside of a food market. Seating is communal, so it will need to be shared with people dining at the other restaurants, that being said I‚Äôve never had a problem finding a table even for a large group, but that could very depending on which day of the week you‚Äôre dining out. I can‚Äôt speak too much on the service as they really only bring your food to you and bus your table after you‚Äôve finished. Now the reason why we‚Äôre really here is for the food, I would highly recommend the scallop ceviche. It is by far the best dish I have tried. The pulpo taco comes in second for me. Both of these dishes are a must. I‚Äôve tried a few other dishes, but nothing really worth noting, however I still have a list of things I‚Äôd like to try. 3.5/5. I‚Äôm a bit spilt on Holbox. Many rave about it as it has a Michelin recognition. The food is very fresh as it‚Äôs constantly rotating due to the high demand. The menu is somewhat unique and there‚Äôs definitely interesting, palatable flavors and ingredients. However, it wasn‚Äôt overly delicious or unique enough to scream home about. You could have similar Mexican seafood experience in other mom and Pop restaurants around town. Personally, it wasn‚Äôt worth the hype.

There‚Äôs an attempt to have fast service, but you won‚Äôt be able to avoid the hour long wait. Longer, including getting your food. The place is located inside a packed and busy food hall, so it can be a struggle to find your own table. Another big thing is sanitation. Due to the high demand, there wasn‚Äôt a meticulous practice on keeping the stations, food prep, and cross contamination clean. I'm OBSESSED. I love this place, I work so close and I can't believe I never knew about this place in the last 5 years. Everything I've tried here is amazing. My favorites might be the smoked kanpachi taco, taco de pulpo en su tinta, scallop taco, and the churros are the best churros I've ever had (which I kind of feel bad for saying bc I've tried churros in Spain). I'm gonna try their entire menu over time, and I'm sure I'm gonna love every single menu item.

Besides the amazing food, the service is also really great!!! In addition, they list all the allergens in their food on the menu, so I was able to take my friend who is gluten-free there without any worries!!

I've brought so many people here since I found out about it 2 weeks ago.

In a food court renovated from an industrial plant near USC, this is one of dozens of food stalls and the most popular one. It was awarded a Michelin star in 2024 and won the Plate Award or Bib Gourmand in previous years. I just came back from South America, so I skipped ceviche, the national dish of South America and Mexico. In addition to the must-order scallops and sea urchins for every table, I strongly recommend "Scallop Aguachile", which is scallop chili soup with avocado. A dozen delicious scallops surround the avocado cut into a flower shape, and it is very delicious when soaked in chili sauce. Next time I should try octopus tacos. I had the great pleasure of dining at Holbox, a culinary gem nestled within the vibrant La Paloma market near USC, just south of Downtown Los Angeles. This remarkable restaurant, helmed by the talented and deeply passionate Chef Gilbert Cetina, more than earns its Michelin star distinction.

Seated at the counter, diners are treated not only to an extraordinary meal, but to the mesmerizing theater of preparation, with Chef Cetina personally engaging guests as he crafts each dish with precision and care.

For an unforgettable experience, I recommend visiting on a Wednesday or Thursday evening, when the eight-course tasting menu is available. Each course is a revelation ‚Äî inventive, impeccably balanced, and a true celebration of Mexico‚Äôs coastal cuisine.

Holbox is, without exaggeration, one of the finest restaurants in Los Angeles, and without question the best Mexican seafood restaurant I‚Äôve ever had the joy of experiencing. The variety of fish is unmatched, with a menu grounded in locally sourced, line-caught seafood, honoring both sustainability and flavor in every bite. Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5

Undoubtedly the best seafood in Los Angeles and finally getting their much deserved Michelin star in 2024. I have been wanting to visit Holbox for over two years but never had the chance until now.

It‚Äôs all about fresh seafood with a very latin flavor. Several kinds of ceviches, tacos, and tostadas gave the menu away.  That sweet and citrusy scallop aquachile made me wanted to drink the rest of the juice , and how about an octopus taco (blew my mind away) we just got back from Lisbon and this was equally great.  As food were prepared we just kept saying ‚Äúwow‚Äù as they pass us by we‚Äôll have that next time.  If only we had bigger stomachs but there is always a next time.  And those churros for dessert was so good it brought us back to our favorite churros in Seville.  Located inside a food hall surrounded by equally great latin faire reminds me of a small hawker center in Singapore minus the satay grills. Chef Celina definitely upped the ante and has been consistent in his quality since 2017.

We came early and first in line which was awesome because as soon as they opened, the line was already snaking around the parking lot. That only tells you great food with no frills, served well is what makes a perfect meal. Price per person $20‚Äì30 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

I'm still thinking about the pulpo I had there! This place had some very very fresh ceviche. Highly recommend. We weren't expecting to sit at the bar, but they had some seating open (it's very limited). Great service. The home made lemonade is perfectly refreshing. For being Michelin starred, I think one comment is that the two ceviches we got had the same type of flavor. I couldn't really tell the flavors apart between fishes because it was covered by the same ceviche flavor profile. It was delicious nonetheless, but I wonder if other fish dishes on the menu are the same...as I said, I still think about the pulpo. Perfect char, accompanied by the perfect sauce. I'm still thinking about the pulpo I had there! This place had some very very fresh ceviche. Highly recommend. We weren't expecting to sit at the bar, but they had some seating open (it's very limited). Great service. The home made lemonade is perfectly refreshing. For being Michelin starred, I think one comment is that the two ceviches we got had the same type of flavor. I couldn't really tell the flavors apart between fishes because it was covered by the same ceviche flavor profile. It was delicious nonetheless, but I wonder if other fish dishes on the menu are the same...as I said, I still think about the pulpo. Perfect char, accompanied by the perfect sauce. Arguably one of the best restaurants I‚Äôve ever been to. Michelin starred for five years and rightfully so. There‚Äôs no glitz and glam just straightforward amazing food. It‚Äôs located in a food hall/market so you order at the counter and they bring the food to you, but there are a few counter seats available as well.
Everything was super fresh, which you can tell by the fresh fish that are on display in the cooler right behind the chefs. The staff is very helpful and attentive. We spoke with one of the owners Briana and you can tell she has a true passion for what she does.
We went here three nights in a row, not for lack of restaurant options as there are plenty to choose from in Los Angeles, but because it was just an amazing experience all around.
We tried the scallop Agua Chile, several of the tostadas, all the tacos, the grilled kanpachi collars, coctel de camarones, the scallop and Uni ceviche, and several other dishes. Every single, one of them deserves perfect reviews. Their freshly made blue corn tortillas alone are worth the trip.
Prices are very modest and won‚Äôt break the bank for the quality of food and service that you receive. Add this to your must try list for the next time you‚Äôre in LA. We couldn‚Äôt be happier with the food vendor we chose for our wedding‚Äîit was phenomenal! Even six months later, we still have guests raving about how delicious and memorable the food was. The flavors were bold, authentic, and elevated‚Äîeverything you‚Äôd want from high-quality Mexican cuisine, especially for a wedding. The presentation was beautiful, and the entire meal felt both festive and refined.

Despite some challenges with our venue not allowing them to use the indoor kitchen, the team worked seamlessly with an outdoor kitchen setup we arranged. They handled the situation with complete professionalism, flexibility, and a great attitude. The food was hot, fresh, and incredibly flavorful. From start to finish, everything was clean, well-organized, and sanitary.

One of the highlights was the late-night tacos‚Äîguests loved them! My husband mentioned how much he enjoyed their salsa, and they generously offered him the entire bottle to take home at the end of the night, which was such a thoughtful touch. The desserts were equally incredible‚Äîespecially the churros, which were made fresh on the spot and absolutely unforgettable.

There was more than enough food for everyone, and we were even given leftovers to take home. They also handled all the cleanup and removed every bit of trash from the site. Their team was so professional, both in how they dressed and how they interacted with our guests. Even some of our pickiest guests commented on how much they enjoyed the food‚Äîwhich says a lot!

We highly, highly recommend this vendor for any event. They helped make our wedding not just delicious, but unforgettable. Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Hidden Gem That Earned Its Star ‚Äì Holbox, Los Angeles

IG: the_hungry_emil

I've been dining at¬†Holbox¬†inside Paloma Market for years, well before it earned its Michelin star, and it's been consistently exceptional every single time.

This visit began with the¬†Halibut Tostada, showcasing incredibly fresh fish over a smooth avocado pur√©e with vibrant pico de gallo‚Äîlight, crisp, and full of flavor.

Next up, the¬†Scallop Aguachile¬†truly impressed. Raw scallops were sweet and briny, perfectly balanced by a zesty green chile-lime sauce, and beautifully presented with red onions and an avocado rose.

I then sampled a trio of tacos:

The¬†Octopus Taco¬†was unlike any I‚Äôve had‚Äîtender grilled octopus served on a deep, savory squid ink sofrito with bright bursts of tomato and chive.

The¬†Scallop Taco¬†featured a seared scallop, lightly caramelized on the outside, paired with a peppery sauce and shredded lettuce for freshness.

The¬†Smoked Kampachi Taco¬†came in a crisp shell, delivering a subtle smokiness to the cooked yellowtail‚Äîunique and absolutely delicious.

Every dish reflects a careful blend of traditional Baja flavors with modern technique and elegance. Holbox is a must-visit for anyone who loves Mexican seafood done right‚Äîand elevated to fine-dining standards. Everything here is simply fantastic.

I stopped by Tuesday around noon (of course, right at lunch time) and parking was horrendous but I'm sure it's this bad any time of the day considering how small the lot is and how little street parking is available.

The line was long but moved at a good pace. The cashier was super sweet and offered good recommendations while also explaining the meaning of Holbox when I asked so thank you to her!

I ordered a little bit of everything to get the full range of taste.

First up was the ceviche de atuna or tuna ceviche. Wow. Some of the freshest most amazing tuna you'll find, this beats out a lot of sushi restaurants too. The ceviche had great flavor and the chips/tostadas on the side were the perfect pairing. My only minor complaint here was the somewhat off-balance of ceviche mix to tuna. The mix is a bit overpowering and I started picking out more of the tuna, because there was already so much stuck onto each piece.

Next up was the kanpachi tostada. My fault for not eating this right away as the tostada got a bit soggy but wow - another stellar dish. The uni was the cherry on top to add a textural change as well as that ocean freshness.

The baja fish taco has to be one of the best fish tacos, even one of the best tacos I've ever had in LA. Simply done even at Michelin standards. The fish was light and so crispy, the tortilla was soft and fresh, and the salsa was perfect.

Lastly and another amazing dish - the smoked kanpachi quesadilla. The Kanpachi was sooo good and light, it was cheesy and the salsa added so much depth of flavor.

This place is a must for any Mexican and seafood lover Meal type Lunch Price per person $20‚Äì30 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Reservation Reservations not required

Lastly and another amazing dish - the smoked kanpachi quesadilla. The Kanpachi was sooo good and light, it was cheesy and the salsa added so much depth of flavor.

Everything here is simply fantastic.

I stopped by Tuesday around noon (of course, right at lunch time) and parking was horrendous but I'm sure it's this bad any time of the day considering how small the lot is and how little street parking is available.

The line was long but moved at a good pace. The cashier was super sweet and offered good recommendations while also explaining the meaning of Holbox when I asked so thank you to her!

I ordered a little bit of everything to get the full range of taste.

First up was the ceviche de atuna or tuna ceviche. Wow. Some of the freshest most amazing tuna you'll find, this beats out a lot of sushi restaurants too. The ceviche had great flavor and the chips/tostadas on the side were the perfect pairing. My only minor complaint here was the somewhat off-balance of ceviche mix to tuna. The mix is a bit overpowering and I started picking out more of the tuna, because there was already so much stuck onto each piece.

Next up was the kanpachi tostada. My fault for not eating this right away as the tostada got a bit soggy but wow - another stellar dish. The uni was the cherry on top to add a textural change as well as that ocean freshness.

The baja fish taco has to be one of the best fish tacos, even one of the best tacos I've ever had in LA. Simply done even at Michelin standards. The fish was light and so crispy, the tortilla was soft and fresh, and the salsa was perfect.

Lastly and another amazing dish - the smoked kanpachi quesadilla. The Kanpachi was sooo good and light, it was cheesy and the salsa added so much depth of flavor.

Holbox might just be the best food court or fast-casual dining experience you‚Äôll ever have. The quality coming out of this kitchen far exceeds what you‚Äôd expect from a counter-service setup‚Äîit‚Äôs almost a mismatch in the best possible way.

Ordering was smooth and easy, and the food arrived quickly. Chips and salsa were served first, which was a nice touch while we waited for the main dishes.

The setting can be seen as either charming or simply casual, but either way, there‚Äôs ample seating in the food court, so finding a table isn‚Äôt an issue.

While I personally find this style of casual dining a bit unglamorous‚Äîand wish I could enjoy a cold beer with my ceviche‚ÄîI recognize that the stripped-down setup keeps overhead low, and that value is clearly passed on to the customer. Had an amazing time here, truly the best bang for your buck for fresh, authentic Mexican seafood in LA that is, yes, Michelin starred! In additional to sampling a few tacos and tostadas (I prefer the tacos in terms of the vehicle for the seafood - the tortilla is really soft and supple), we also splurged on the uni, which came freshly cracked open and loaded with scallop. What also shocked me was how good the DESSERT was - one of the best churros I've ever had, pillowy and the chocolate sauce was just the right consistency and sweetness. Service was great and there was plenty of seating in the food hall. Overall, an excellent meal! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $20‚Äì30 Recommended dishes Churros Con Chocolate

I finally tried this place on my day off! There was a line that moved pretty fast at 1:30pm, but it was slow by 3pm. Plenty of food court seating. I found street parking easily on a weekday. The seafood was definitely fresh and yummy. I tried their octopus taco, smoked kanpachi taco, uni/kanpachi tostada, and shrimp aguachile. My fav was probably the tostada, but I have to say the uni was lost in the strong flavors of the ceviche. I'd say try any of the ceviche options to be satisfied.

Their operation is clearly well run, affordable for what the menu is, and presentation is amazing. But I was expecting more from the flavors. I didn't find any of the flavors innovative or new. Their tacos are simple and that's an item that can easily be experimented on. They have a good sized menu. I wish it was smaller and even more simple to showcase the fresh seafood or have more experimental/innovative options on the menu. Overall it was a good seafood experience. I'm not sure how I'd feel if I had to battle a weekend line. Also, not sure if I'd go out of my way to come back on my own, but for sure with newcomers. I'd love to try their other ceviche options. Came here on a Sunday and joined the line around 11:15, before they opened and the line was already out the door. Ordered by 11:50 and got my food by noon. If you're going to come here, aim for off-peak hours or come early. Got the Ceviche Mixto, Kanpachi and Uni Tostada, and Baja Fish Taco. Everything was perfect. Their octopus and scallop are exceptional. Everything else was honestly on par with other good, non-Michelin taco spots.

I will say, only the line is a long wait. After your order, they actually bring your food out pretty quickly, and they'll bring it out as it's ready. Plenty of seating inside and outside, you don't need to be one of those people who save a table before you've even ordered. Food was amazing. The line was quick.

Went here on a Friday afternoon at opening. There was already a line to get in. However, you can also sit at the counter and get table service there. I found an empty seat and took advantage. It's located in a food court, so expect a packed house.

I was helped quickly by a gentleman. I started off with a sparkling lemonade and a taco de pulpo en su tinta. The taco was very good. The octopus was tender and went well with the calamari ink sofrito. Next I got a tostada de atun. Bluefin tuna, avocado puree and arbol peanut sauce. The combination of all 3 were great! And the homemade tostada was easy to eat. Didn't crumble at any bites, so you're enjoying every component of the plate. Lastly, I got an entr√©e of pulpo a la brasa. The smokiness of the octopus combined with the almond pipian was spot-on! Combine that to make a taco with the baby tomatoes and avocado slices it was a perfect combo!

Overall, a great experience at $57.00. The server was attentive, although his attitude changed after my 15% tip. It's all good. Doesn't take away from the overall experience. I highly recommend coming here. Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $50‚Äì100 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4

Wife and I went for early dinner around 3:30 on Sunday (1/19/25). Got a parking spot right away. There was already a 20 deep line just for Holbox. Ordered around 4 pm the grilled octopus plate (pulpo a las brasas), grilled kanpachi collars and a cold halibut tostada (tostada de lenguado). Attentive servers delivered chips and salsa right away. Food started arriving in 20 minutes. Halibut tostada was awesome and fresh. Octopus plate with habanero sauce was just the best...no rubbery morsel here!!! My wife thoroughly enjoyed the fish collar. In between, the wait staff were quick to add a baja fish taco my wife wanted to try. I would go back just to have the same dishes let alone try other items on the menu!! Wife and I went for early dinner around 3:30 on Sunday (1/19/25). Got a parking spot right away. There was already a 20 deep line just for Holbox. Ordered around 4 pm the grilled octopus plate (pulpo a las brasas), grilled kanpachi collars and a cold halibut tostada (tostada de lenguado). Attentive servers delivered chips and salsa right away. Food started arriving in 20 minutes. Halibut tostada was awesome and fresh. Octopus plate with habanero sauce was just the best...no rubbery morsel here!!! My wife thoroughly enjoyed the fish collar. Came to this place while in town yesterday and have been wanting to try this since watching an episode of a food show on Youtube they were featured on. This honestly has to be top 5-10 best meals I've ever had in my life. Seriously. The seafood is so fresh and melts in your mouth. I had the garlic butter shrimp plate with the grilled bread, cilantro rice, and beans, and the flavor of the shrimp sauce was AMAZING. Since I was hungry, I had an array of different items, including the Tostada with the Kampachi, shrimp, and another fish, and it was out of this world!! The salsas are soooo good! The guacamole was cool (maybe needed a pinch of salt). But the showstopper were the CHURROS. Oh my god!!! Those Churros with the chocolate sauce? INSANE!!! Honestly, I'm going back again before I leave but seriously, this place is beyond words. The prices are reasonable but also range, depending on the dish and it's worth every penny. This place is deserving of its Michellin star and more. Thank you for creating this magical place. Holbox, I love you!!! Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

What can one say about Holbox? It is in a big food court. It has gotten a lot of press, and has a Michelin star. I will start with the food, but I have a lot to say about the experience.

You can upload the menu on your phone or get someone in your group to grab a menu. It is good to use your wait time in the long line to the ordering counter wisely. Send others to grab drinks from another vendor. Buy a few tacos from another vendor if you are hungry.

We tried a lot of dishes. The Baja shrimp taco is traditional, but the shrimp are huge and moist, and the crema and toppings are great. Also quite good was the tostado de jurel. It is yellowtail ceviche, avocado, and an almond salsa on a very crispy corn tortilla base. It was fresh, sour, savory, and yummy. I found the scallop aguachile to be a bit too lime forward, which tends to drown out the sweetness of scallops, but if you eat it with the pieces of avocado and chips, it mellows everything out. Needless to say, all the seafood is bright and fresh.

My companions really loved the smoked kanpachi tacos, all hot and cheesy, and spicy. The camarones al mojo were sensational. This is a main dish platter, so comes with excellent black beans and cilantro rice, plus toasted bread for sopping up the marinade. The shrimp were HUGE and perfectly prepared. So all in all, the food is terrific.

So the downsides: You will pretty much have a 30 to 45 minute wait before you can order. You will need to hunt out a table in the loud, noisy, and not very clean dining hall. The food comes out in no particular order. This makes the actual dining rather chaotic. Our 6 items cost over $100. Michelin star or not, to me, how I am served and the atmosphere in which I eat makes a difference. Is the food great? Yes. Does eating it amid the chaos make it less nice? Yes, absolutely.

I have eaten at a lot of Michelin started restaurants all over the world. Does this rate a Michelin star? I don't think so. But I do recommend eating here. The food is just terrific. Fresh wood-grilled fish is the best, but I often get their Baja style tacos or the scallop taco.   Civeches are wonderful. The fish soup is also excellent with its various seafood content. Many other wonderful dishes, oysters, cocktail,  branzinos. Earned Michelin Bib Gourmand two years in a row. One of the best seafood restaurants in Los Angeles without the hefty prices. Situated  in the Mercado la Paloma. I highly recommend this place. Chef Gilberto has been nominated for the James Beard Award for Chef of the year. Holbox is expanding its counter space for more seating and an open kitchen concept. HOLBOX was no. 1 Los Angeles restaurant last year and is no. 5 this year. It has also earned a Michelin Star this year
This is no small feat and tells of incredible and tasty foods and a testament to the creativity of Chef Gilberto. Closed on Mondays, otherwise the line to order food is constant. Come and try it! Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $20‚Äì30

Situated  in the Mercado la Paloma. I highly recommend this place. Chef Gilberto has been nominated for the James Beard Award for Chef of the year. Holbox is expanding its counter space for more seating and an open kitchen concept. HOLBOX was no. 1 Los Angeles restaurant last year and is no. 5 this year. It has also earned a Michelin Star this year
This is no small feat and tells of incredible and tasty foods and a testament to the creativity of Chef Gilberto. Closed on Mondays, otherwise the line to order food is constant. Come and try it! Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $20‚Äì30

Been coming here before the Times review and the Michelin recognition and the place continues to serve good fresh Mexican style seafood.  Too bad it‚Äôs so over exposed now- the place can get busy.  The food is typical of seafood you might get in Baja or mainland Mexico (but more refined than a typical street counter), so to me it‚Äôs not a mind blowing experience, or anything new (wonder if the Michelin reviewers are a bunch of gringos?) I‚Äôve had stellar seafood in Mexico- perhaps even better from street stands; however, this is one of my go to places when I need a good authentic seafood fix without the drive down to Baja or to try differnt places from East LA.  The cocktail here is good (I‚Äôve had better from seafood trucks); the fish tacos are good (not as good as an Ensenada fish taco); the ceviche is great- generous portions with high quality fish- the style is not as tangy as a Peruvian style ceviche, but recommended.  The octopus taco is one of my favorites.    Definitely worth a visit- but I recommend angelenos venture out to other Mexican seafood options in LA to experience authentic food options that are just as tastey as well.  (I digress) Media hype can ruin a place, thankfully, this place maintains high quality food. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $20‚Äì30 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4

We dropped by around 1 PM for lunch, wow the parking here was a bit of a challenge.  Once we got that, there was a line to order, that wasn't too bad but was roughly about 20 minutes overall.

We were lucky enough to be next in line with counter seating opening up for two people.  Once there, the wait staff took our order right away and we were given chips and salsa to munch on while we waited.

Taco De Pulpo En Su Tinta - Amazingly soft, well seasoned and extremely tasty.  A must order.

Scallop Aguachile - A bit tart, but so refreshing and perfect melding of flavor and texture between the scallops and avocado.  A very recommended order.

Erizo Sea Urchin Uni - Incredibly fresh sea urchin atop fish and scallops ceviche?  Who says no to that?  A very recommended order.

Sopa De Mariscos - I'm not a good judge of seafood soups because I love them all, but I feel confident in saying this is maybe one of the best I've ever eaten.  Make sure you dip that grilled bread, I think it's the best way to enjoy this dish honestly.  A must must order.

Oh, don't forget to order the Sparkling Lemonade.

Overall we had a great meal there and are already planning our next visit. My husband and I recently had the pleasure of dining at Holbox for lunch during a whirlwind weekend in LA, and I can confidently say that the experience was nothing short of spectacular! The food was absolutely delightful‚Äîeach dish was succulent and bursting with flavor, leaving me craving more.

While we started with the classic guacamole, we also tried the Baja and shrimp tacos simply because the line moved so fast we didn't get a chance to review the menu. Holbox operates like a well-oiled machine, ensuring fast and attentive service that perfectly complements the delightful food. I was particularly impressed with the portions of the seafood soup, and the smoked kampachi tostado was a treat for anyone who enjoys that rich, smoky flavor. However, the true stars of the meal were the bluefin ceviche and the kampachi and uni tostado. They were so exquisite that, despite being full, I simply couldn‚Äôt help but savor every last bite. A big thank you to Gilberto for recommending the ceviche‚Äîit was a highlight of my culinary adventure!

As I left, I found myself already planning a return trip to try the abalone, lobster, and octopus. A girl can only eat but so much in one sitting. üòÜ

Gilberto, I look forward to seeing you in my city soon at Zahav! Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $50‚Äì100 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 3 Recommended dishes Fresh Seafood, Sopa De Mariscos, Guacamole and Tostada, Chips & Salsa, Baja Shrimp Taco

This was my first time doing a tasting menu and first time dining somewhere with a michelin star. Personally, I think it was worth the hype!

The food was excellent and as the chef walked us through each dish, it was amazing to see how much thought goes into sourcing each ingredient. Some of the dishes are now in my personal Hall of Fame Bites (kanpachi crudo, abalone tamale), and the shrimp and spiny lobster meat were the most delicate and sweet I've ever had. I thought it was very reasonably priced for everything I got, and I left feeling the perfect amount of full.

I'm going to return and try things off the regular menu! Thank you to the staff for such an amazing experience. Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Was super excited to check out Holbox, especially since they were awarded a Michelin star for 2024. We ordered a bunch of their dishes and the quality of the fish is amazing. They have a self serve sauce station with 5 different sauces. We loved the dark one (didn‚Äôt get the name of it) as it had a nice smoky flavor but not too much heat.

The standout dishes to us were the octopus taco (pulpo), baja fish taco, tuna tostada, and  mesquite grilled branzino with rice, beans, and tortillas (filete al carbon). We liked how they had blue corn tortillas, which complemented the seafood really well!

I would recommend coming early if you don‚Äôt want to wait in line for too long. We arrived around 11:15 and were among the first group of people to be seated. By the time we left, the line was out the door! Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $20‚Äì30 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

A great find near USC‚Äôs campus. Holbox is located in a larger food hall, and although there was a line, it moved quickly. This was the best food I‚Äôve had in LA so far ‚Äî we ordered fairly reasonably priced items and felt incredibly satisfied leaving. I was able to have perfectly crunchy and soft bites of the Baja Fish Taco, which tasted even more delicious topped with the extra hot sauces that are provided by the counter. I also got to try the Baja Shrimp Taco which offered very different flavors, but made you feel like you were eating seaside. The Filete al Carbon was another good one ‚Äî plenty of beans and rice and avo with a healthy filet of branzino. Would recommend splitting a few different dishes if you‚Äôre going with someone else! The market was bustling but we found seating easily and it was enjoyable to be around other people that were loving the taste of their food, too. Seems like a great place for lunch, a casual date, or just a fun outing with kids! I‚Äôm dying to go back‚Ä¶ Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $10‚Äì20 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Fresh Seafood, Chips & Salsa Kid-friendliness As noted, this hall has a lot of different vibes, making it great for kids to people watch or just chill. The amount of stimulation is great for kids, although they may not be satisfied without dessert when they notice some of the other options!

A great find near USC‚Äôs campus. Holbox is located in a larger food hall, and although there was a line, it moved quickly. This was the best food I‚Äôve had in LA so far ‚Äî we ordered fairly reasonably priced items and felt incredibly satisfied leaving. I was able to have perfectly crunchy and soft bites of the Baja Fish Taco, which tasted even more delicious topped with the extra hot sauces that are provided by the counter. I also got to try the Baja Shrimp Taco which offered very different flavors, but made you feel like you were eating seaside. The Filete al Carbon was another good one ‚Äî plenty of beans and rice and avo with a healthy filet of branzino. Would recommend splitting a few different dishes if you‚Äôre going with someone else! The market was bustling but we found seating easily and it was enjoyable to be around other people that were loving the taste of their food, too. Seems like a great place for lunch, a casual date, or just a fun outing with kids! Incre√≠ble! The best Mexican style seafood I've had anywhere. They start you off with chips and salsa, and a variety of spicy habanero or arbol chiles. The roasted habanero salsa was a killer but very addictive.

Then we got the scallop aguachile and soft shell crab, both of which were perfectly done. The scallops were especially fresh, and the aguachile was well balanced between spicy, zesty, and refreshing.

Then we finished with two tacos and a seafood stew. All of which were amazing. The stew had a thick, flavorful saffron infused broth that imparted a ton of extra flavor to the seafood. The tortillas they used for the tacos were great too and clearly homemade.

Overall, an outstanding spot worth a visit. As visitors from NYC, we were super glad we stopped by. Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $30‚Äì50 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Sopa De Mariscos, Fresh Seafood

This place is the truth. Wow is the first thing that comes to my mind when I first ate here. My girlfriend and I both agreed this was probably the best food we ever had in our lives. We went with 1 of each kind of taco(shared them to taste each one), the halibut ceviche, and the scallop Aguachile with the sparkling lemonade. Just wow 12/10. The flavors were so amazing and refreshing and blended together so well. The fish tacos really stuck out they were the more simple of all the tacos but everything went together so perfectly, highly recommend. The smoked kanpachi taco also stood out as one of my favorites. You can‚Äôt go wrong with anything on the menu really. We were visiting from out of town from the Bay Area and I would legit take another trip down there just to eat at Holbox. Can‚Äôt recommend it enough, don‚Äôt hesitate, just go and try it for yourself! Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $30‚Äì50 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes

We drove all the way from Lake Forest to try Hobox, recently awarded a Michelin star, and located in a food court. There was a line stretching to the door, but it moved fairly quickly. After ordering, we grabbed a number and found a seat by the door. Unfortunately, things took a turn when the line was moved inside, right next to our table. It was loud and awkward to eat with people standing so close, so we had to relocate mid-meal. Thankfully, shortly after we moved, they relocated the line back outside to address the same concerns other diners had.

As for the food, we started with the sparkling lemonade, which was wonderfully bubbly with a perfectly balanced sweet and acidic flavor. It tasted freshly squeezed with no artificial coloring, giving it a very homemade feel.

Next, we received complimentary chips and salsa. The chips were freshly fried and crunchy, but the salsa was a bit too acidic for my taste.

We ordered the uni and kanpachi tostada, which had simple yet effective flavors of salt, pepper, and lime juice that allowed the freshness of the fish and uni to really shine.

The ceviche mixto had a similar flavor profile‚Äîsalt, pepper, lime juice, finely chopped onions, tomatoes, cilantro, and a mix of fresh fish, shrimp, and octopus. While the seafood was undeniably fresh, I found it too salty and lacking in umami. A touch of sweetness and more depth would have made it more enjoyable. The tostada that accompanied the ceviche was light, airy, and perfectly crunchy‚Äînot your typical tostada, which was a nice surprise.

For the tacos, the scallop tacos were absolutely delicious. The scallops were tender, and the pickled onions and grilled cherry tomatoes added just the right amount of acidity to balance the dish. The octopus tacos were the highlight. Perfectly cooked octopus paired with calamari ink sofrito created an unforgettable dish‚Äîone of the best octopus taco I‚Äôve ever had. They did forget to remove the bay leaf from the sofrito, though I‚Äôm not sure if that was intentional.

We also tried the Taco de Pescado al Carbon, featuring mesquite grilled Baja California kanpachi, mayo, morita sauce, cabbage, pico de gallo, and avocado puree. The fish was tender, but the skin was a little too chewy for my taste‚ÄîI would have preferred it to be crunchier.

The shrimp tacos, while decent, didn‚Äôt particularly stand out. They featured battered fried shrimp, garnish, and mayo, which was good but nothing extraordinary.

Overall, it was a great experience trying unique dishes, and I‚Äôd definitely return. Next time, I‚Äôll stick to the hot tacos and skip the ceviche unless they add more umami. Food: 4 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 3

Holbox is an absolute gem! Went there the other night and finally understand why it got that Michelin nod for 2024. The vibe is relaxed, yet the food is out of this world.

We ordered a bunch of tacos to try: Smoked Kanpachi Taco - wow, the smoky flavor was just right. Then there was the Taco de Pulpo en su Tinta, which was an explosion of rich, tangy ink sauce paired with perfectly cooked octopus. The Taco de Pescado al Carbon had that amazing char-grilled flavor, and the Scallop Taco - so tender and fresh, I honestly wanted another round of those. The Baja Fish Taco didn‚Äôt disappoint either; crispy and flavorful, just how it should be.

For sharing, we got the Pulpo A Las Brasas and Coctel Mixto. The grilled octopus (Pulpo A Las Brasas) was a standout - tender, with a crispy exterior and packed with flavor. The Coctel Mixto was a delightful, refreshing mix of seafood that balanced out the richer dishes perfectly.

Overall, Holbox delivered an incredible dining experience with every single dish. It‚Äôs definitely a must-visit for anyone looking to explore high-end Mexican fusion food. Can't wait to go back and try more! Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $20‚Äì30 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Holbox is an absolute gem! Went there the other night and finally understand why it got that Michelin nod for 2024. The vibe is relaxed, yet the food is out of this world.

We ordered a bunch of tacos to try: Smoked Kanpachi Taco - wow, the smoky flavor was just right. Then there was the Taco de Pulpo en su Tinta, which was an explosion of rich, tangy ink sauce paired with perfectly cooked octopus. The Taco de Pescado al Carbon had that amazing char-grilled flavor, and the Scallop Taco - so tender and fresh, I honestly wanted another round of those. The Baja Fish Taco didn‚Äôt disappoint either; crispy and flavorful, just how it should be.

For sharing, we got the Pulpo A Las Brasas and Coctel Mixto. The grilled octopus (Pulpo A Las Brasas) was a standout - tender, with a crispy exterior and packed with flavor. The Coctel Mixto was a delightful, refreshing mix of seafood that balanced out the richer dishes perfectly.

Overall, Holbox delivered an incredible dining experience with every single dish. It‚Äôs definitely a must-visit for anyone looking to explore high-end Mexican fusion food. Can't wait to go back and try more! Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $20‚Äì30 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Holbox Los Angeles is an exceptional culinary destination that delivers a high-quality dining experience, worthy of its Michelin star. Nestled within Mercado la Paloma, a historic landmark brimming with culture and a variety of unique food offerings, this restaurant provides a unique and memorable dining experience.

I began my meal with the Taco de pulpo en su tinta, a delightful dish featuring braised and fried Gulf of Mexico octopus. The octopus was tender and perfectly cooked, enhanced by the rich, savory calamari ink sofrito. The depth of flavor in this dish was outstanding, with each bite revealing a nuanced blend of textures and tastes that truly highlighted the quality of the ingredients.

Next, I indulged in the Scallop taco, a masterpiece of pan-seared Maine diver scallops. The scallops were succulent and cooked to perfection, accompanied by a vibrant salsa "x'catic" that added a touch of heat. The caramelized onions, tomato, and marinated fennel provided a sweet and tangy contrast, elevating the overall flavor profile of the dish. The combination of these elements created a harmonious and sophisticated taste that lingered pleasantly on the palate.

The C√≥ctel mixto was another highlight, featuring a mix of wild Mexican shrimp, Gulf of Mexico octopus, and Baja bay scallop. The seafood was fresh and succulent, and the house-made sweet and sour cocktail sauce added a refreshing and zesty touch. The balance of sweetness and acidity in the sauce complemented the natural flavors of the seafood beautifully, making this dish a refreshing and satisfying option.

The ambiance at Holbox is charming and laid-back, set within the vibrant environment of Mercado la Paloma. The market itself is a treasure trove of cultural experiences, offering a diverse array of food choices. It's a great place to explore and soak in the rich cultural tapestry of Los Angeles.

Holbox's approach to customer service is unique, with a casual system where food and drinks are dropped off at your table, rather than traditional waiter service. This setup adds to the relaxed atmosphere, allowing diners to enjoy their meal at their own pace without the formality of a traditional restaurant.

Overall, my experience at Holbox was delightful. Each dish showcased a thoughtful blend of high-quality ingredients and innovative flavors, making it clear why this establishment has earned a Michelin star. The ambiance and service add to the experience, making it a must-visit for anyone looking to explore the rich culinary landscape of Los Angeles. This is a Mexican restaurant specializing in fresh and delicious seafood.

The food is delicious, and I was surprised by how beautifully the food is plated. The ceviche is also a flavor that all Koreans would like. The fish tacos and kanpachi tacos were more delicious than the octopus tacos. And the salsa sauce was incredibly delicious.

There is a self-service bar with various hot sauces made in the restaurant behind the ordering area, so you can use them for free.

However, since it is a famous restaurant, there are many people, so most of the time there are many customers during meal times. It would be better to visit on a day with a little more time rather than visiting during a busy schedule. After returning the rental car and taking an Uber back to my accommodation, I happened to come across a building with a cool mural. I looked it up on Google Maps and found this restaurant, and strangely enough, I really liked it. I didn‚Äôt know it was closed on Mondays, so I went there in vain, but I went back on Wednesday and enjoyed a delicious meal. When I looked at Google Maps, I couldn‚Äôt tell if it was a Michelin restaurant, but I think I was very lucky. This restaurant uniquely serves Mexican food from the Yucatan Peninsula. The internet steered us to Holbox and wow I am glad that it did! Located in a nondescript food court/mall, Chef Gilbert Centina and his team serve elevated Mexican seafood. I've eaten excellent food in Mexico City and this is comparable in quality to the best I tried over there. This restaurant could easily be located in a fancy venue with significantly more expensive prices, so it's to the great fortune of Los Angeles (and tourists like myself) that it isn't.

We had the kanpachi (smoked fish) and uni tostada, baja fish and pulpo en su tinta (octopus in calamari ink sofrito) tacos, and ceviche (catch of the day ‚Äî we had tuna). The seafood was all incredibly fresh and delectable. I'm not a fan of octopus but I knew that Holbox makes a good one, and sure enough it had the light flakiness of a delicate fish. There was no "fishy" flavour and the sauces were thoughtful and complemented the meat well (I particularly enjoyed the ink sauce that accompanied the octopus taco).

The table also has five different hot sauces, which are fun to eat with the chips and salsa served before the meal.

We arrived ten minutes before opening and didn't need to wait in line. There was consistently a line the entire time we were there, but it seemed to be moving quickly.

One last thing: shout out to the Oaxacan place across the aisle in the food court that makes an awesome cafe de olla! Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Chips & Salsa Parking space Plenty of parking Parking options Free parking lot, Free street parking

Extremely disappointed in the Holbox experience. The food was decent at best with no one dish truly standing out. I had the c√≥ctel mixto, the pecado a las brasas (sea bass), tostada de Kanpachi & Uni, taco de pescado al carb√≥n, baja shrimp taco, and a lemonade.

The standout dish among those was the kanpachi & uni tostada but that not saying much considering all the dishes were of average quality. I expected more from the hype and was disappointed.  As I looked around the Mercado I realized that people had exceptional dishes from the other restaurants in the market. The atmosphere was typical of a Mercado, busy and loud, which is fine. However, the food left a lot to be desired given the Michelin acclaim and hype. I honestly believe the star isn‚Äôt justified and it was likely awarded because of where the restaurant is located (South L.A) and let‚Äôs face it, someone in the hood had to get a star. I guess they will only concern about you when you order the tasting menu that is over $100 per person‚Ä¶I would rather go to Guerrilla Taco in downtown LA, at least you receive good service, sit at proper environment and get food with reasonable pricing. Seeing as this was my first time dining here - I grabbed a little bit of everything. Here is my review by item:

Halibut tostada - 10/10 - Spectacular, by far the best halibut ceviche I have had to date. The fish is premium quality and melt-in your mouth and the exact right amount of citrus to spice.

Atun Tostada (Tuna Ceviche) - 7/10 - Good. The fish is very fresh but the flavor profile of the ceviche mix can use some work. Also, I am a seafood lover and the white-ish sauce paired with the tuna looked unappealing at first presentation, even to me.

Taco de Pulpo en su Tinta (Braised Octopus taco)  - 0/10 - Disgusting!!!! So gross the lingering flavor was making me nauseous on the ride home. (Note: Ive eaten octopus many times - I tried this based on many good experiences). You get a big tortilla with just a piece of crisped (bland) octopus that tasted old and had an extremely gamey flavor. I hated this. Regret ordering it.

Scallop Taco - 1/10 - A throwaway dish undeserving of the good money paid for it. Turns out Scallops don‚Äôt belong in tacos. Being such a novelty I just had to try it. Huge mistake. Again, the tortilla to filling ratio was way off. All I could taste was bread. The scallops were extremely bland, had a boiled texture - no sear, no char. With only 2 scallops in a thick tortilla, it was like they weren‚Äôt even there. Such a waste of perfectly good scallops. Hated this.

All 3 stars are for the ceviches (tostadas). The cooked seafood is so awful I am insulted I was charged money for them as I feel I should be paid for the trouble of eating them. Food: 3 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4

1. Seafood Tostada

A crispy tostada topped with plenty of fresh shrimp and fish! The sauce was a bit strong, but the ingredients were incredibly fresh. It felt like eating a piece of the ocean in one bite.

2. Tuna Tartare

The crispy minced tuna topped with avocado was visually and flavorfully satisfying. The tortillas provided a variety of textures, and the sauce was beautifully presented.

3. Green Shrimp Aguachile

The large shrimp and the green sauce were refreshing and tangy. The cucumber and onion complemented each other well, leaving a lasting impression. The flavor could be a bit strong.

4. Raw Oyster Plate

Fresh oysters generously served on ice! The basics were perfect, and the three different sauces made it even more enjoyable to enjoy. The refreshing flavor was a bonus.

5. Uni in Sea Urchin Shell

The visuals were absolutely stunning! However, the strong sauce underneath overshadowed the uni's unique savory flavor, which was a shame. The visual appeal was truly Instagram-worthy.

6. Octopus Grill Plate

The octopus was chewy on the outside and had a smoky flavor! The grilled lemon, avocado, and tomato salad complemented the dish perfectly, making both the plating and the taste satisfying.

7. Two Tacos (Fish + Octopus)

The fish taco had a crispy batter and the savory sauce complemented it well. The octopus taco was bursting with smoky flavor! Both were served on blue corn tortillas, adding a unique touch of color.

A crispy tostada topped with plenty of fresh shrimp and fish! The sauce was a bit strong, but the ingredients were incredibly fresh. It felt like eating a piece of the ocean in one bite.

2. Tuna Tartare

The crispy minced tuna topped with avocado was visually and flavorfully satisfying. The tortillas provided a variety of textures, and the sauce was beautifully presented.

3. Green Shrimp Aguachile

The large shrimp and the green sauce were refreshing and tangy. The cucumber and onion complemented each other well, leaving a lasting impression. The flavor could be a bit strong.

4. Raw Oyster Plate

Fresh oysters generously served on ice! The basics were perfect, and the three different sauces made it even more enjoyable to enjoy. The refreshing flavor was a bonus.

5. Uni in Sea Urchin Shell

The visuals were absolutely stunning! However, the strong sauce underneath overshadowed the uni's unique savory flavor, which was a shame. The visual appeal was truly Instagram-worthy.

6. Octopus Grill Plate

The octopus was chewy on the outside and had a smoky flavor! The grilled lemon, avocado, and tomato salad complemented the dish perfectly, making both the plating and the taste satisfying.

7. Two Tacos (Fish + Octopus)

The fish taco had a crispy batter and the savory sauce complemented it well. The octopus taco was bursting with smoky flavor! Both were served on blue corn tortillas, adding a unique touch of color.

Holbox ‚Äì A Missed Catch in a City Full of Great Tacos

I really wanted to love Holbox. It‚Äôs one of LA‚Äôs most talked-about spots‚ÄîMichelin-starred, James Beard‚Äìnominated, raved about on every food blog worth its salt. But for us, it just didn‚Äôt land.

From the start, service was disorganized. Our dessert arrived before our food, and we had to flag down three different team members just to get our order. They did refund the dessert‚Äîwhich we appreciated‚Äîbut honestly, it wasn‚Äôt worth serving in the first place. The cheesecake was dense, dry, and flavorless. It felt like an afterthought in a place that shouldn‚Äôt be mailing anything in.

The lobster dish was a real letdown. Coming from a coastal town where lobster is a way of life, I was excited‚Äîbut what arrived was chewy and overcooked. The rice and beans alongside it were actually great, but not what you come here for.

Michael ordered an assortment of tacos. The scallop taco was undercooked and had an off taste. The smoked kampachi taco had a cool concept, but wasn‚Äôt something either of us wanted more than a bite of. The Baja shrimp taco? That one was solid‚Äîbut LA is a city of incredible tacos. If you‚Äôre going to be one of the top taco spots here, you really have to bring it. Holbox didn‚Äôt.

The ceviche was the one bright spot in terms of taste. The fish was fresh and well-marinated, but it was plated in a way that felt messy and overwhelming. The portion was huge and oddly presented‚Äîmore cafeteria scoop than culinary elegance.

The fryer oil was another surprise. I have a soybean allergy‚Äîto boot‚Äîso I couldn‚Äôt even try some of the items, including the chips and fish tacos I was most excited about. They use a blended oil with soybean in their fryer, which was really unfortunate.

There‚Äôs a lot of potential here‚Äîfresh fish, inventive ideas, a casual setup that‚Äôs very LA. But execution matters, and for us, it just didn‚Äôt deliver.

In the end, the best things I had were my Diet Coke, the rice and beans, and a taco I couldn‚Äôt even eat. It‚Äôs safe to say we won‚Äôt be returning. If we ever do find ourselves back at this market, we‚Äôll be trying the other counters instead. Service Dine in Meal type Lunch Price per person $30‚Äì50 Food: 3 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 2
